text: this whole exhibit hall is strewn with
green vehicles that's because a theme of
this year's LA Auto Show is
environmental sustainability hi I'm
Jerry Garrett a contributor for the New
York Times you know some of these
environmentally friendly vehicles here
are real and others are just flights of
fancy but one that is very real and
ready to hit the road right now is
Honda's FCX concept this is a visitor
from the automotive industries near
future this wild whale tailed sedan runs
on lithium ion batteries and liquid
hydrogen and it goes up to 270 miles on
a tank full of fuel the hydrogen tanks
by the way are hidden in the space where
the driveshaft used to be and that's
part of the reason why the tail is so
long honda says the production version
of the FCX will look pretty much like
the concept you see here honda plans to
lease a select number of these cars not
sell them the ones that will be
available for sale or still several
years off and honda says right now
they'd be too expensive to sell to the
general public could be worth the wait
though i'm gerry garrett for the new
york times
